articles.title: High interest rates mean a boom for fixed-income investments, but taxes may be a buzzkill. - USA TODAY
articles.description: Americans are taking advantage of high interest rates to invest more in fixed-income assets like bonds or CDs, but experts warn of higher taxes ahead.
articles.content:
Soaring interest rates have rekindled Americans penchant for fixed-income investments like bonds and money market funds, but experts warn that they should be prepared for the taxes.
